comments.commentBody: Trump did not think he was inheriting the problem of N. Korea? The sad part is that somehow, I find that totally believable.

The NYT's article is a prime example of irresponsible journalism, all done in the name of freedom of the press. There are certain things that should be left unsaid or unpublished. No doubt this story was immediately read by the North Koreans. Can nothing be kept as a State Secret? North Korea is the enemy of the free world. We are in an undeclared war with this rogue state.

FYI. Several levels of editing are involved before any material that might be deemed sensitive goes to print.
You should instead be worrying about what has been revealed by the revolving door policy of Donald Trump, when it comes to Russia and this country's National Security.

No kidding! What has editing got to do with publishing facts that may aid the enemy. No, I am not a Trump supporter. You need to get over it. He's the president, for better or worse (from what I see so far it's worse). Hillary would have been as toxic. Blame the DNC for that fiasco.

Hey Donald. Maybe the US would not be so "Obsolete in Cyber" if G. W. Bush had not cut the tax rate to the middle and upper class.

You get what you pay for.

And, no, it will not be OK to starve the poor or cut back on Social Security and Medicare to make ends meet. These elderly folks have paid out whatever they were asked for 30 years by deductions from their paychecks. Just because the US Govt invested it in low interest bonds is not their problem. They are owed full Medicare and Social Security.

So....where is the money for "Cyber" coming from if you are cutting everybody's taxes massively, including the inheritance tax for the only families who pay it now, which are currently estates over $10 million?????

The difference is that North Korea doesn't want to open up to the rest of the world.  That's why Kim killed his uncle and brother.  Both were friendly with China and wanted to open up the economy like China did.
I see Trump and Kim Jong-un, as very similar characters. Very similar.

Obama, pacifist and idealist to a fault, stood by and did nothing while foreign entities hacked our industrial companies, state secrets, and defense companies. No retaliation, no deterrence.  And now, our enemies are emboldened and Russia,  China and North Korea are laughing at us as they continue bullying their neighbors.

Unless you have access to classified State Department material, there is NO WAY you can make a statement regarding what was, and wasn't done by the Obama administration by way of protecting this country against cyber activity -- But he had to know something, in order to warn the Trump adminstration about it like he did.

Biased fantasy from someone who paid no attention until Barack Obama became president. How did his predecessor do on the national security value scale you ascribe to? The "pacifist" went in and killed Osama bin Laden, authorized many, many drone strikes, and degraded ISIS seriously.  This stuff's been going on for generations. How do you change the way we interact in the world? Like W or like Obama? Obama finished some stuff, but he didn't want to start it.

Before dawn, our president was alternating tweets about Arnold Schwarzenegger's television ratings on The Apprentice and angry accusations that former president Barack Obama had been tapping his telephone lines.

This is the man standing between us and nuclear holocaust.

I believe in a free and independent Press as protected by the 1st Amendment, it's absolutely necessary as a check in balance in our Federal System.

However there are times when the Press has shown restraint in it's reporting for the sake of the safety of the Republic. FDR's alleged extra-marital affairs, Regan's initial stages of Dementia come to mind as examples.

NYTs do we have to release this story right at this time when we are already faced with several Trump related Consistutional Crisies?

Appreciate the lack of sleep.

Former President Obama warned President Trump? Was this before or after Obama planted all those leaks to sabotage Trump's presidency.

Add this to the pile of things Obama has "left" for Trump to contend with.

Obama didn't need to plant any leaks to "sabotage" Trump's presidency -- Trump is doing that all on his own...plus, there's evidence!
If anything, former President Obama has provided this country with a view into everthing Trump is doing his utmost to cover up.
We owe him a debt of thanks for that.

Live and learn.
Just to find a new word, for me, in "Opsimath", made my day. Amazing work, EC & HR. Thanks for the "Aha" moment.

Do Republicans believe in a solution to a Rubic's cube or a 3000 piece puzzle? I doubt it.

The alleged goat was meant to break the Republican House of Mirrors and lies on everything. Goats do not like Republicans either.

They also want to replace the bridge with another one to nowhere - like to their lobbiests - and destroy the existing bridge while citizens are still on it.

Republicans are the ones pretending to sell bus tickets while pickpocketing their citizen as they are distracted.

Don't be surprised by the burning carpet and roof. Republicans are into Global Burning and have been burning down the house, the planet, the economy, access to health care and creating wars of choice so that they can build Mega-Mansions on top of the ruins of us.

Cow bell Cruz? More like Gong Show Cruz. As for Mr Sand for Brains, his nonsense speaks for itself.

Republicans are not capable of doing either puzzle insofar as governing for the benefit of the American people.

However, they can solve either if it leads to more tax cuts for the .1% without difficulty.

That is where their skill set, which includes not having a conscience, lies.

Uber deceives their drivers, too. It's the bedrock of their business model. "Make great money as an independent Uber driver...". Except, you're not independent. You have no control of the business you're operating as an Uber driver, other than to work or not to work. You can't nurture your business, build a clientele, or even advertise your business. Worse yet, Uber refuses to tell you the destination of a ride before you accept said ride. In the past, and perhaps presently, they have penalized drivers for not accepting rides. Uber refuses to add a tip feature in the rider app. Collectively, Uber drivers have a larger investment in Uber than all VC money combined. Yet, Uber drivers have no stock in Uber. It's an enormous scam, enabled by the prospect of entrepreneurial gain. In reality, Uber drivers are using their vehicles as an ATM machine - taking value out of their car to make money. It's a horrible con most figure out, which is why the turnover rate is so high. Why the IRS hasn't stepped into deem drivers as employees is a mystery.
There were suits in CA and UBER fought tooth and nail to not be classified as an employer but in at least one case a driver won.

"Collectively, Uber drivers have a larger investment in Uber than all VC money combined. "

Umm, no. Just not true.

The drivers are not contractors. They are defacto employees.
Uber is committing tax evasion (payroll taxes) and MUST be prosecuted!!
Tax evasion is a FELONY!!

From my wife's experience with Uber, it isn't always cheaper than a taxi, but often more quickly available where taxis are is short supply.  From conversations with drivers, many of them use it as a way to make extra money in off hours from other jobs or going to school.  The services  are not necessarily mutually exclusive.  There are both advantages and disadvantages to Uber:  if you are in a place with poor internet, you have to get your ride by phone; Uber is internet based via app, so that can be a problem with a place that has spotty internet, as can coordination with where to pick you up (know this from first hand experience).  At places like airports, taxis may have a dedicated place to be, but Uber does not and has to pick you up "on the fly", so coordinating where you are can get interesting.  Also, Uber drivers may decide not to pick you up after all, and you end up back in the Uber queue.  We will continue to use both, as the situation suits.

So arrogant you are. People can choose to drive for or with the uber.
They have in waves. Nobody is making them. Uber has gift wrapped and
delivered a way for people to make and save money.

Not guilty.  The cops use an app to target drivers they plan to steal from, because they "suspect" the person may be guilty of a crime.. It goes both ways.  Uber is not obligated to pick up every customer that calls.

Did you read the story?  These were enforcement officers from the transportation department and UBER was operating illegally in Portland.  They did notentrap anyone, steal from them etc. etc. etc.  UBER was in the wrong.  I feel sorry for the drivers, not the company headed by vultures.

Human being: They were not illegal at the time. Later on, city "officials" said Uber was illegal, then promptly legalized them after negotiation. I do not think anyone but the courts should be ruling on legality or illegality.

Guess you didn't read the story.
People who touted Uber are now seeing how bad they are. They tried replacing legal immigrants who drove taxi's with white male and females. The Uber's of the world are bad for the economy.
so it was not that taxis were not available in those cities you visit and lived in, it is rather your opinion they were too expensive or inconvenient for you. a different situation, entirely.

Taiwan has shown the world how to beat Greyball. Make every rider a potential undercover compliance officer by offering them a cash reward for reporting illegal operators. Get a cheap fare, then get a reward on top of that. Money talks people!
That argues for more regulation, not less.

When a company invest this much thought into skirting the law, you have to wonder what they aren't addressing.

Like perhaps sexual harassment of their female engineers.

How about getting the GreyBall app to drop these cops off where there are problems with citizens shooting each other with guns?  What is the threat that they are "protecting" us from to begin with?  If you don't want to take an Uber ride, just don't do it.  I don't need the police to choose my ride.   Get back to work protecting the public.   How about taking down the drug companies that manufacture deathly Fentonil for instance?    My bet is that Uber would be better at that than our men and women in blue.     Hire these Uber and Lyft folks for "The Wire"-like IT team and get to work on real problems, please.

Uber found a niche and took it. It also gave people jobs, perhaps not very well paid but jobs anyway. Technology has propelled Uber and Lyft and the other taxi companies now must catch up to stay viable. Competition is good for the consumer.
Because too often the driver is scary and because they don't chop in for the expense of the roads they drive on!
I'm thinking these guys are pretty brilliant - but it was only a matter of time until they got caught.  Tough to stick it to the man these days, baby.
Yes,  that is a silly thing. Immigrants are Uber drivers too,  and most money made from cabs goes to medallion owners not drivers.

until justice is instituded uber is a theif; cities that had required medalians, yet allowed uber are unjust. pay cabbies back for the nedalions , if u want or, much better, require same of uber.
hypocrasy does nt make justice. period
